meanings.definition: The act of making something resemble an animal.
meanings.sent1: Her animalizations of the toys made them look like little creatures.
meanings.sent2: The artist's animalizations of the trees in the painting were incredibly lifelike.
meanings.sent3: The animalizations of the vegetables in the garden made them seem like they were alive and dancing.
meanings.sent4: His animalizations of the clouds as fluffy animals brought a whimsical touch to the sky.
meanings.sent5: The animalizations of the rocks as sleeping animals made the landscape enchanting.

meanings.definition: The process of treating someone or something as if they were an animal.
meanings.sent1: The animalizations of the students by the strict teacher were not appreciated.
meanings.sent2: His constant animalizations of the robot made it seem like a real pet.
meanings.sent3: The animalizations of the alarm clock as a hungry monster made waking up more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her animalizations of the old car as a tired horse were surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent5: The animalizations of the computer as a clever monkey helped the children understand technology better.
